name: truncate
shortDescription: shrink or extend the size of a file to the specified size
longDescription: Shrink or extend the size of each FILE to the specified size

options.name: no-create
options.description: Do not create files that do not exist.

options.name: io-blocks
options.description: Treat SIZE as number of I/O blocks of the FILE rather than bytes.

options.name: reference
options.description: Base the size of each FILE on the size of RFILE.

options.name: size
options.description: Set or adjust the size of each FILE according to SIZE.  SIZE is in bytes unless ‘--io-blocks’ is specified.  SIZE may be, or may be an integer optionally followed by, one of the following multiplicative suffixes: ‘KB’ =>           1000 (KiloBytes) ‘K’  =>           1024 (KibiBytes) ‘MB’ =>      1000*1000 (MegaBytes) ‘M’  =>      1024*1024 (MebiBytes) ‘GB’ => 1000*1000*1000 (GigaBytes) ‘G’  => 1024*1024*1024 (GibiBytes) and so on for ‘T’, ‘P’, ‘E’, ‘Z’, and ‘Y’.
